00089 // This lock ensures delegates only receive one notification that authentication is required at once
00090 // When using ASIAuthenticationDialogs, it also ensures only one dialog is shown at once
00091 // If a request can't aquire the lock immediately, it means a dialog is being shown or a delegate is handling the authentication challenge
00092 // Once it gets the lock, it will try to look for existing credentials again rather than showing the dialog / notifying the delegate
00093 // This is so it can make use of any credentials supplied for the other request, if they are appropriate
00094 static NSRecursiveLock *delegateAuthenticationLock = nil;

00145 + (void)initialize
00146 {
00147         if (self == [ASIHTTPRequest class]) {
00148                 progressLock = [[NSRecursiveLock alloc] init];
00149                 bandwidthThrottlingLock = [[NSLock alloc] init];
00150                 sessionCookiesLock = [[NSRecursiveLock alloc] init];
00151                 sessionCredentialsLock = [[NSRecursiveLock alloc] init];
00152                 delegateAuthenticationLock = [[NSRecursiveLock alloc] init];
00153                 bandwidthUsageTracker = [[NSMutableArray alloc] initWithCapacity:5];
00154                 ASIRequestTimedOutError = [[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIRequestTimedOutErrorType userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:@"The request timed out",NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,nil]] retain];    
00155                 ASIAuthenticationError = [[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIAuthenticationErrorType userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:@"Authentication needed",NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,nil]] retain];
00156                 ASIRequestCancelledError = [[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIRequestCancelledErrorType userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:@"The request was cancelled",NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,nil]] retain];
00157                 ASIUnableToCreateRequestError = [[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIUnableToCreateRequestErrorType userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:@"Unable to create request (bad url?)",NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,nil]] retain];
00158                 ASITooMuchRedirectionError = [[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASITooMuchRedirectionErrorType userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:@"The request failed because it redirected too many times",NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,nil]] retain];    
00159 
00160 #if TARGET_OS_IPHONE
00161                 isiPhoneOS2 = ((floorf([[[UIDevice currentDevice] systemVersion] floatValue]) == 2.0) ? YES : NO);
00162 #else
00163                 isiPhoneOS2 = NO;
00164 #endif
00165         }
00166         [super initialize];

00171 {

00173         [self setRequestMethod:@"GET"];
00174 
00175         [self setShouldPresentCredentialsBeforeChallenge:YES];
00176         [self setShouldRedirect:YES];
00177         [self setShowAccurateProgress:YES];
00178         [self setShouldResetProgressIndicators:YES];
00179         [self setAllowCompressedResponse:YES];
00180         [self setDefaultResponseEncoding:NSISOLatin1StringEncoding];
00181         [self setShouldPresentProxyAuthenticationDialog:YES];
00182         
00183         [self setTimeOutSeconds:10];
00184         [self setUseSessionPersistance:YES];
00185         [self setUseCookiePersistance:YES];
00186         [self setValidatesSecureCertificate:YES];
00187         [self setRequestCookies:[[[NSMutableArray alloc] init] autorelease]];
00188         [self setDidFinishSelector:@selector(requestFinished:)];
00189         [self setDidFailSelector:@selector(requestFailed:)];
00190         [self setURL:newURL];
00191         [self setCancelledLock:[[[NSRecursiveLock alloc] init] autorelease]];
00192         return self;

00204                 CFRelease(requestAuthentication);

00206         if (proxyAuthentication) {
00207                 CFRelease(proxyAuthentication);
00208         }
00209         if (request) {
00210                 CFRelease(request);
00211         }
00212         [self cancelLoad];
00213         [userInfo release];
00214         [mainRequest release];
00215         [postBody release];
00216         [compressedPostBody release];
00217         [error release];

00256 - (void)addRequestHeader:(NSString *)header value:(NSString *)value
00257 {
00258         if (!requestHeaders) {
00259                 [self setRequestHeaders:[NSMutableDictionary dictionaryWithCapacity:1]];
00260         }
00261         [requestHeaders setObject:value forKey:header];
00262 }
00263 
00264 // This function will be called either just before a request starts, or when postLength is needed, whichever comes first
00265 // postLength must be set by the time this function is complete
00266 - (void)buildPostBody
00267 {
00268         if ([self haveBuiltPostBody]) {
00269                 return;
00270         }
00271         
00272         // Are we submitting the request body from a file on disk
00273         if ([self postBodyFilePath]) {
00274                 
00275                 // If we were writing to the post body via appendPostData or appendPostDataFromFile, close the write stream
00276                 if ([self postBodyWriteStream]) {
00277                         [[self postBodyWriteStream] close];
00278                         [self setPostBodyWriteStream:nil];
00279                 }
00280 
00281                 NSError *err = nil;
00282                 NSString *path;
00283                 if ([self shouldCompressRequestBody]) {
00284                         [self setCompressedPostBodyFilePath:[NSTemporaryDirectory() stringByAppendingPathComponent:[[NSProcessInfo processInfo] globallyUniqueString]]];
00285                         [ASIHTTPRequest compressDataFromFile:[self postBodyFilePath] toFile:[self compressedPostBodyFilePath]];
00286                         path = [self compressedPostBodyFilePath];
00287                 } else {
00288                         path = [self postBodyFilePath];
00289                 }
00290                 [self setPostLength:[[[NSFileManager defaultManager] attributesOfItemAtPath:path error:&err] fileSize]];
00291                 if (err) {
00292                         [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIFileManagementError userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:[NSString stringWithFormat:@"Failed to get attributes for file at path '@%'",path],NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,error,NSUnderlyingErrorKey,nil]]];
00293                         return;
00294                 }
00295                 
00296         // Otherwise, we have an in-memory request body
00297         } else {
00298                 if ([self shouldCompressRequestBody]) {
00299                         [self setCompressedPostBody:[ASIHTTPRequest compressData:[self postBody]]];
00300                         [self setPostLength:[[self compressedPostBody] length]];
00301                 } else {
00302                         [self setPostLength:[[self postBody] length]];
00303                 }
00304         }
00305                 
00306         if ([self postLength] > 0) {
00307                 if ([requestMethod isEqualToString:@"GET"] || [requestMethod isEqualToString:@"DELETE"] || [requestMethod isEqualToString:@"HEAD"]) {
00308                         [self setRequestMethod:@"POST"];
00309                 }
00310                 [self addRequestHeader:@"Content-Length" value:[NSString stringWithFormat:@"%llu",[self postLength]]];
00311         }
00312         [self setHaveBuiltPostBody:YES];
00313 }
00314 
00315 // Sets up storage for the post body
00316 - (void)setupPostBody
00317 {
00318         if ([self shouldStreamPostDataFromDisk]) {
00319                 if (![self postBodyFilePath]) {
00320                         [self setPostBodyFilePath:[NSTemporaryDirectory() stringByAppendingPathComponent:[[NSProcessInfo processInfo] globallyUniqueString]]];
00321                         [self setDidCreateTemporaryPostDataFile:YES];
00322                 }
00323                 if (![self postBodyWriteStream]) {
00324                         [self setPostBodyWriteStream:[[[NSOutputStream alloc] initToFileAtPath:[self postBodyFilePath] append:NO] autorelease]];
00325                         [[self postBodyWriteStream] open];
00326                 }
00327         } else {
00328                 if (![self postBody]) {
00329                         [self setPostBody:[[[NSMutableData alloc] init] autorelease]];
00330                 }
00331         }       
00332 }
00333 
00334 - (void)appendPostData:(NSData *)data
00335 {
00336         [self setupPostBody];
00337         if ([data length] == 0) {
00338                 return;
00339         }
00340         if ([self shouldStreamPostDataFromDisk]) {
00341                 [[self postBodyWriteStream] write:[data bytes] maxLength:[data length]];
00342         } else {
00343                 [[self postBody] appendData:data];
00344         }
00345 }
00346 
00347 - (void)appendPostDataFromFile:(NSString *)file
00348 {
00349         [self setupPostBody];
00350         NSInputStream *stream = [[[NSInputStream alloc] initWithFileAtPath:file] autorelease];
00351         [stream open];
00352         int bytesRead;
00353         while ([stream hasBytesAvailable]) {
00354                 
00355                 unsigned char buffer[1024*256];
00356                 bytesRead = [stream read:buffer maxLength:sizeof(buffer)];
00357                 if (bytesRead == 0) {
00358                         break;
00359                 }
00360                 if ([self shouldStreamPostDataFromDisk]) {
00361                         [[self postBodyWriteStream] write:buffer maxLength:bytesRead];
00362                 } else {
00363                         [[self postBody] appendData:[NSData dataWithBytes:buffer length:bytesRead]];
00364                 }
00365         }
00366         [stream close];
00367 }
00368 
00369 - (void)setDelegate:(id)newDelegate
00370 {
00371         [[self cancelledLock] lock];
00372         delegate = newDelegate;
00373         [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00374 }
00375 
00376 - (void)setQueue:(id)newQueue
00377 {
00378         [[self cancelledLock] lock];
00379         queue = newQueue;
00380         [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00381 }

00383 #pragma mark get information about this request
00384 
00385 - (BOOL)isFinished 
00386 {
00387         return [self complete];
00388 }
00389 
00390 
00391 - (void)cancel
00392 {
00393         [[self cancelledLock] lock];
00394 
00395         if ([self isCancelled] || [self complete]) {
00396                 [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00397                 return;
00398         }
00399         
00400         [self failWithError:ASIRequestCancelledError];
00401         [self setComplete:YES];
00402         [self cancelLoad];
00403         [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00404         
00405         // Must tell the operation to cancel after we unlock, as this request might be dealloced and then NSLock will log an error
00406         [super cancel];
00407         
00408 
00409 }

00412 // Call this method to get the received data as an NSString. Don't use for binary data!
00413 - (NSString *)responseString
00414 {
00415         NSData *data = [self responseData];
00416         if (!data) {
00417                 return nil;
00418         }
00419         
00420         return [[[NSString alloc] initWithBytes:[data bytes] length:[data length] encoding:[self responseEncoding]] autorelease];
00421 }
00422 
00423 - (BOOL)isResponseCompressed
00424 {
00425         NSString *encoding = [[self responseHeaders] objectForKey:@"Content-Encoding"];
00426         return encoding && [encoding rangeOfString:@"gzip"].location != NSNotFound;
00427 }
00428 
00429 - (NSData *)responseData
00430 {       
00431         if ([self isResponseCompressed]) {
00432                 return [ASIHTTPRequest uncompressZippedData:[self rawResponseData]];
00433         } else {
00434                 return [self rawResponseData];
00435         }
00436 }

00440 // Run a request asynchronously by adding it to the global queue
00441 // (Use [request start] for a synchronous request)
00442 - (void)startAsynchronous
00443 {
00444         [[ASIHTTPRequest sharedRequestQueue] addOperation:self];
00445 }

00447 
00448 #pragma mark request logic
00449 
00450 // Create the request
00451 - (void)main
00452 {
00453         
00454         NSAutoreleasePool *pool = [[NSAutoreleasePool alloc] init];
00455         
00456         @try {
00457                 
00458                 [self setComplete:NO];
00459                 
00460                 if (![self url]) {
00461                         [self failWithError:ASIUnableToCreateRequestError];
00462                         [pool release];
00463                         return;         
00464                 }
00465                 
00466                 // Must call before we create the request so that the request method can be set if needs be
00467                 if (![self mainRequest]) {
00468                         [self buildPostBody];
00469                 }
00470                 
00471                 // If we're redirecting, we'll already have a CFHTTPMessageRef
00472                 if (request) {
00473                         CFRelease(request);
00474                 }
00475 
00476                 // Create a new HTTP request.
00477                 request = CFHTTPMessageCreateRequest(kCFAllocatorDefault, (CFStringRef)[self requestMethod], (CFURLRef)[self url], [self useHTTPVersionOne] ? kCFHTTPVersion1_0 : kCFHTTPVersion1_1);
00478                 if (!request) {
00479                         [self failWithError:ASIUnableToCreateRequestError];
00480                         [pool release];
00481                         return;
00482                 }
00483                 
00484 
00485                 
00486                 //If this is a HEAD request generated by an ASINetworkQueue, we need to let the main request generate its headers first so we can use them
00487                 if ([self mainRequest]) {
00488                         [[self mainRequest] buildRequestHeaders];
00489                 }
00490                 
00491                 // Even if this is a HEAD request with a mainRequest, we still need to call to give subclasses a chance to add their own to HEAD requests (ASIS3Request does this)
00492                 [self buildRequestHeaders];
00493                 
00494                 [self applyAuthorizationHeader];
00495                 
00496                 
00497                 NSString *header;
00498                 for (header in [self requestHeaders]) {
00499                         CFHTTPMessageSetHeaderFieldValue(request, (CFStringRef)header, (CFStringRef)[[self requestHeaders] objectForKey:header]);
00500                 }
00501                 
00502                 [self loadRequest];
00503                 
00504                 
00505         } @catch (NSException *exception) {
00506                 NSError *underlyingError = [NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIUnhandledExceptionError userInfo:[exception userInfo]];
00507                 [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIUnhandledExceptionError userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:[exception name],NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,[exception reason],NSLocalizedFailureReasonErrorKey,underlyingError,NSUnderlyingErrorKey,nil]]];
00508         }       
00509         
00510         [pool release];
00511 }
00512 
00513 - (void)applyAuthorizationHeader
00514 {
00515         // Do we want to send credentials before we are asked for them?
00516         if ([self shouldPresentCredentialsBeforeChallenge]) {
00517                 
00518                 // First, see if we have any credentials we can use in the session store
00519                 NSDictionary *credentials = nil;
00520                 if ([self useSessionPersistance]) {
00521                         credentials = [self findSessionAuthenticationCredentials];
00522                 }
00523                 
00524                 
00525                 // Are any credentials set on this request that might be used for basic authentication?
00526                 if ([self username] && [self password] && ![self domain]) {
00527                         
00528                         // If we have stored credentials, is this server asking for basic authentication? If we don't have credentials, we'll assume basic
00529                         if (!credentials || (CFStringRef)[credentials objectForKey:@"AuthenticationScheme"] == kCFHTTPAuthenticationSchemeBasic) {
00530                                 [self addBasicAuthenticationHeaderWithUsername:[self username] andPassword:[self password]];
00531                         }
00532                 }
00533                 
00534                 if (credentials && ![[self requestHeaders] objectForKey:@"Authorization"]) {
00535                         
00536                         // When the Authentication key is set, the credentials were stored after an authentication challenge, so we can let CFNetwork apply them
00537                         // (credentials for Digest and NTLM will always be stored like this)
00538                         if ([credentials objectForKey:@"Authentication"]) {
00539                                 
00540                                 // If we've already talked to this server and have valid credentials, let's apply them to the request
00541                                 if (!CFHTTPMessageApplyCredentialDictionary(request, (CFHTTPAuthenticationRef)[credentials objectForKey:@"Authentication"], (CFDictionaryRef)[credentials objectForKey:@"Credentials"], NULL)) {
00542                                         [[self class] removeAuthenticationCredentialsFromSessionStore:[credentials objectForKey:@"Credentials"]];
00543                                 }
00544                                 
00545                                 // If the Authentication key is not set, these credentials were stored after a username and password set on a previous request passed basic authentication
00546                                 // When this happens, we'll need to create the Authorization header ourselves
00547                         } else {
00548                                 NSDictionary *usernameAndPassword = [credentials objectForKey:@"Credentials"];
00549                                 [self addBasicAuthenticationHeaderWithUsername:[usernameAndPassword objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationUsername] andPassword:[usernameAndPassword objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationPassword]];
00550                         }
00551                 }
00552                 if ([self useSessionPersistance]) {
00553                         credentials = [self findSessionProxyAuthenticationCredentials];
00554                         if (credentials) {
00555                                 if (!CFHTTPMessageApplyCredentialDictionary(request, (CFHTTPAuthenticationRef)[credentials objectForKey:@"Authentication"], (CFDictionaryRef)[credentials objectForKey:@"Credentials"], NULL)) {
00556                                         [[self class] removeProxyAuthenticationCredentialsFromSessionStore:[credentials objectForKey:@"Credentials"]];
00557                                 }
00558                         }
00559                 }
00560         }       
00561 }
00562 
00563 - (void)buildRequestHeaders
00564 {
00565         if ([self haveBuiltRequestHeaders]) {
00566                 return;
00567         }
00568         [self setHaveBuiltRequestHeaders:YES];
00569         
00570         if ([self mainRequest]) {
00571                 for (NSString *header in [[self mainRequest] requestHeaders]) {
00572                         [self addRequestHeader:header value:[[[self mainRequest] requestHeaders] valueForKey:header]];
00573                 }
00574                 return;
00575         }
00576         
00577         // Add cookies from the persistant (mac os global) store
00578         if ([self useCookiePersistance] ) {
00579                 NSArray *cookies = [[NSHTTPCookieStorage sharedHTTPCookieStorage] cookiesForURL:[self url]];
00580                 if (cookies) {
00581                         [[self requestCookies] addObjectsFromArray:cookies];
00582                 }
00583         }
00584         
00585         // Apply request cookies
00586         NSArray *cookies;
00587         if ([self mainRequest]) {
00588                 cookies = [[self mainRequest] requestCookies];
00589         } else {
00590                 cookies = [self requestCookies];
00591         }
00592         if ([cookies count] > 0) {
00593                 NSHTTPCookie *cookie;
00594                 NSString *cookieHeader = nil;
00595                 for (cookie in cookies) {
00596                         if (!cookieHeader) {
00597                                 cookieHeader = [NSString stringWithFormat: @"%@=%@",[cookie name],[cookie value]];
00598                         } else {
00599                                 cookieHeader = [NSString stringWithFormat: @"%@; %@=%@",cookieHeader,[cookie name],[cookie value]];
00600                         }
00601                 }
00602                 if (cookieHeader) {
00603                         [self addRequestHeader:@"Cookie" value:cookieHeader];
00604                 }
00605         }
00606         
00607         // Build and set the user agent string if the request does not already have a custom user agent specified
00608         if (![[self requestHeaders] objectForKey:@"User-Agent"]) {
00609                 NSString *userAgentString = [ASIHTTPRequest defaultUserAgentString];
00610                 if (userAgentString) {
00611                         [self addRequestHeader:@"User-Agent" value:userAgentString];
00612                 }
00613         }
00614         
00615         
00616         // Accept a compressed response
00617         if ([self allowCompressedResponse]) {
00618                 [self addRequestHeader:@"Accept-Encoding" value:@"gzip"];
00619         }
00620         
00621         // Configure a compressed request body
00622         if ([self shouldCompressRequestBody]) {
00623                 [self addRequestHeader:@"Content-Encoding" value:@"gzip"];
00624         }
00625         
00626         // Should this request resume an existing download?
00627         if ([self allowResumeForFileDownloads] && [self downloadDestinationPath] && [self temporaryFileDownloadPath] && [[NSFileManager defaultManager] fileExistsAtPath:[self temporaryFileDownloadPath]]) {
00628                 NSError *err = nil;
00629                 [self setPartialDownloadSize:[[[NSFileManager defaultManager] attributesOfItemAtPath:[self temporaryFileDownloadPath] error:&err] fileSize]];
00630                 if (err) {
00631                         [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIFileManagementError userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:[NSString stringWithFormat:@"Failed to get attributes for file at path '@%'",[self temporaryFileDownloadPath]],NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,error,NSUnderlyingErrorKey,nil]]];
00632                         return;
00633                 }
00634                 [self addRequestHeader:@"Range" value:[NSString stringWithFormat:@"bytes=%llu-",[self partialDownloadSize]]];
00635         }       
00636         
00637 }
00638 
00639 - (void)startRequest
00640 {
00641         [[self cancelledLock] lock];
00642         
00643         if ([self isCancelled]) {
00644                 [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00645                 return;
00646         }
00647         
00648         [self setAuthenticationLock:[[[NSConditionLock alloc] initWithCondition:1] autorelease]];
00649         
00650         [self setComplete:NO];
00651         [self setTotalBytesRead:0];
00652         [self setLastBytesRead:0];
00653         
00654         // If we're retrying a request after an authentication failure, let's remove any progress we made
00655         if ([self lastBytesSent] > 0) {
00656                 [self removeUploadProgressSoFar];
00657         }
00658         
00659         [self setLastBytesSent:0];
00660         if ([self shouldResetProgressIndicators]) {
00661                 [self setContentLength:0];
00662                 [self resetDownloadProgress:0];
00663         }
00664         [self setResponseHeaders:nil];
00665         if (![self downloadDestinationPath]) {
00666                 [self setRawResponseData:[[[NSMutableData alloc] init] autorelease]];
00667     }
00668     // Create the stream for the request
00669         
00670         // Do we need to stream the request body from disk
00671         if ([self shouldStreamPostDataFromDisk] && [self postBodyFilePath] && [[NSFileManager defaultManager] fileExistsAtPath:[self postBodyFilePath]]) {
00672                 
00673                 // Are we gzipping the request body?
00674                 if ([self compressedPostBodyFilePath] && [[NSFileManager defaultManager] fileExistsAtPath:[self compressedPostBodyFilePath]]) {
00675                         [self setPostBodyReadStream:[ASIInputStream inputStreamWithFileAtPath:[self compressedPostBodyFilePath]]];
00676                 } else {
00677                         [self setPostBodyReadStream:[ASIInputStream inputStreamWithFileAtPath:[self postBodyFilePath]]];
00678                 }
00679                 readStream = CFReadStreamCreateForStreamedHTTPRequest(kCFAllocatorDefault, request,(CFReadStreamRef)[self postBodyReadStream]);
00680     } else {
00681                 
00682                 // If we have a request body, we'll stream it from memory using our custom stream, so that we can measure bandwidth use and it can be bandwidth-throttled if nescessary
00683                 if ([self postBody]) {
00684                         if ([self shouldCompressRequestBody] && [self compressedPostBody]) {
00685                                 [self setPostBodyReadStream:[ASIInputStream inputStreamWithData:[self compressedPostBody]]];
00686                         } else if ([self postBody]) {
00687                                 [self setPostBodyReadStream:[ASIInputStream inputStreamWithData:[self postBody]]];
00688                         }
00689                         readStream = CFReadStreamCreateForStreamedHTTPRequest(kCFAllocatorDefault, request,(CFReadStreamRef)[self postBodyReadStream]);
00690                 
00691                 } else {
00692                         readStream = CFReadStreamCreateForHTTPRequest(kCFAllocatorDefault, request);
00693                 }
00694         }
00695 
00696         if (!readStream) {
00697                 [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00698                 [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIInternalErrorWhileBuildingRequestType userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:@"Unable to create read stream",NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,nil]]];
00699         return;
00700     }
00701 
00702         // Tell CFNetwork not to validate SSL certificates
00703         if (!validatesSecureCertificate) {
00704                 CFReadStreamSetProperty(readStream, kCFStreamPropertySSLSettings, [NSMutableDictionary dictionaryWithObject:(NSString *)kCFBooleanFalse forKey:(NSString *)kCFStreamSSLValidatesCertificateChain]); 
00705         }
00706         
00707         
00708         // Handle proxy settings
00709 
00710         // Have details of the proxy been set on this request
00711         if (![self proxyHost] && ![self proxyPort]) {
00712                 
00713                 // If not, we need to figure out what they'll be
00714                 
00715                 NSArray *proxies = nil;
00716                 
00717                 // Have we been given a proxy auto config file?
00718                 if ([self PACurl]) {
00719                         
00720                         proxies = [ASIHTTPRequest proxiesForURL:[self url] fromPAC:[self PACurl]];
00721 
00722                 // Detect proxy settings and apply them 
00723                 } else {
00724                 
00725                         #if TARGET_OS_IPHONE
00726                         #if TARGET_IPHONE_SIMULATOR && __IPHONE_OS_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED < __IPHONE_3_0
00727                         // Can't detect proxies in 2.2.1 Simulator
00728                         NSDictionary *proxySettings = [NSMutableDictionary dictionary]; 
00729                         #else
00730                         NSDictionary *proxySettings = [(NSDictionary *)CFNetworkCopySystemProxySettings() autorelease];
00731                         #endif
00732                         #else
00733                         NSDictionary *proxySettings = [(NSDictionary *)SCDynamicStoreCopyProxies(NULL) autorelease];
00734                         #endif
00735 
00736                         proxies = [(NSArray *)CFNetworkCopyProxiesForURL((CFURLRef)[self url], (CFDictionaryRef)proxySettings) autorelease];
00737                         
00738                         // Now check to see if the proxy settings contained a PAC url, we need to run the script to get the real list of proxies if so
00739                         NSDictionary *settings = [proxies objectAtIndex:0];
00740                         if ([settings objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFProxyAutoConfigurationURLKey]) {
00741                                 proxies = [ASIHTTPRequest proxiesForURL:[self url] fromPAC:[settings objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFProxyAutoConfigurationURLKey]];
00742                         }
00743                 }
00744                 
00745                 if (!proxies) {
00746                         CFRelease(readStream);
00747                         readStream = NULL;
00748                         [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00749                         [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIInternalErrorWhileBuildingRequestType userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:@"Unable to obtain information on proxy servers needed for request",NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,nil]]];
00750                         return;                 
00751                 }
00752                 // I don't really understand why the dictionary returned by CFNetworkCopyProxiesForURL uses different key names from CFNetworkCopySystemProxySettings/SCDynamicStoreCopyProxies
00753                 // and why its key names are documented while those we actually need to use don't seem to be (passing the kCF* keys doesn't seem to work)
00754                 if ([proxies count] > 0) {
00755                         NSDictionary *settings = [proxies objectAtIndex:0];
00756                         [self setProxyHost:[settings objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFProxyHostNameKey]];
00757                         [self setProxyPort:[[settings objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFProxyPortNumberKey] intValue]];
00758                 }
00759         }
00760         if ([self proxyHost] && [self proxyPort]) {
00761                 NSMutableDictionary *proxyToUse = [NSMutableDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:[self proxyHost],kCFStreamPropertyHTTPProxyHost,[NSNumber numberWithInt:[self proxyPort]],kCFStreamPropertyHTTPProxyPort,nil];
00762                 CFReadStreamSetProperty(readStream, kCFStreamPropertyHTTPProxy, proxyToUse);
00763         }
00764         
00765     // Set the client
00766         CFStreamClientContext ctxt = {0, self, NULL, NULL, NULL};
00767     if (!CFReadStreamSetClient(readStream, kNetworkEvents, ReadStreamClientCallBack, &ctxt)) {
00768         CFRelease(readStream);
00769         readStream = NULL;
00770                 [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00771                 [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIInternalErrorWhileBuildingRequestType userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:@"Unable to setup read stream",NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,nil]]];
00772         return;
00773     }
00774     
00775     // Schedule the stream
00776     CFReadStreamScheduleWithRunLoop(readStream, CFRunLoopGetCurrent(), ASIHTTPRequestRunMode);
00777     
00778     // Start the HTTP connection
00779     if (!CFReadStreamOpen(readStream)) {
00780         CFReadStreamSetClient(readStream, 0, NULL, NULL);
00781         CFReadStreamUnscheduleFromRunLoop(readStream, CFRunLoopGetCurrent(), ASIHTTPRequestRunMode);
00782         CFRelease(readStream);
00783         readStream = NULL;
00784                 [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00785                 [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIInternalErrorWhileBuildingRequestType userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:@"Unable to start HTTP connection",NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,nil]]];
00786         return;
00787     }
00788         [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00789         
00790         
00791         if (shouldResetProgressIndicators) {
00792                 double amount = 1;
00793                 if (showAccurateProgress) {
00794                         
00795                         //Workaround for an issue with converting a long to a double on iPhone OS 2.2.1 with a base SDK >= 3.0
00796                         if ([ASIHTTPRequest isiPhoneOS2]) {
00797                                 amount = [[NSNumber numberWithUnsignedLongLong:postLength] doubleValue]; 
00798                         } else {
00799                                 amount = (double)postLength;
00800                         }
00801                 }
00802                 [self resetUploadProgress:amount];
00803         }       
00804         // Record when the request started, so we can timeout if nothing happens
00805         [self setLastActivityTime:[NSDate date]];       
00806 }
00807 
00808 // This is the 'main loop' for the request. Basically, it runs the runloop that our network stuff is attached to, and checks to see if we should cancel or timeout
00809 - (void)loadRequest
00810 {
00811         [self startRequest];
00812         
00813 
00814         // Wait for the request to finish
00815         while (!complete) {
00816                 
00817 
00818                 // We won't let the request cancel until we're done with this cycle of the loop
00819                 [[self cancelledLock] lock];
00820                 
00821                 
00822                 // See if our NSOperationQueue told us to cancel
00823                 if ([self isCancelled] || [self complete]) {
00824                         [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00825                         break;
00826                 }
00827                 
00828                 // This may take a while, so we'll create a new pool each cycle to stop a giant backlog of autoreleased objects building up
00829                 NSAutoreleasePool *pool = [[NSAutoreleasePool alloc] init];
00830                 
00831                 
00832                 NSDate *now = [NSDate date];
00833                 
00834                 // See if we need to timeout
00835                 if (lastActivityTime && timeOutSeconds > 0 && [now timeIntervalSinceDate:lastActivityTime] > timeOutSeconds) {
00836                         
00837                         // Prevent timeouts before 128KB* has been sent when the size of data to upload is greater than 128KB* (*32KB on iPhone 3.0 SDK)
00838                         // This is to workaround the fact that kCFStreamPropertyHTTPRequestBytesWrittenCount is the amount written to the buffer, not the amount actually sent
00839                         // This workaround prevents erroneous timeouts in low bandwidth situations (eg iPhone)
00840                         if (totalBytesSent || postLength <= uploadBufferSize || (uploadBufferSize > 0 && totalBytesSent > uploadBufferSize)) {
00841                                 [self failWithError:ASIRequestTimedOutError];
00842                                 [self cancelLoad];
00843                                 [self setComplete:YES];
00844                                 [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00845                                 [pool release];
00846                                 break;
00847                         }
00848                 }
00849                 
00850                 // Do we need to redirect?
00851                 if ([self needsRedirect]) {
00852                         [self cancelLoad];
00853                         [self setNeedsRedirect:NO];
00854                         [self setRedirectCount:[self redirectCount]+1];
00855                         if ([self redirectCount] > RedirectionLimit) {
00856                                 // Some naughty / badly coded website is trying to force us into a redirection loop. This is not cool.
00857                                 [self failWithError:ASITooMuchRedirectionError];
00858                                 [self setComplete:YES];
00859                                 [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00860                         } else {
00861                                 [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00862                                 // Go all the way back to the beginning and build the request again, so that we can apply any new cookies
00863                                 
00864                                 [self main];
00865                         }
00866                         [pool release];
00867                         break;
00868                 }
00869         
00870                 
00871                 // Find out if we've sent any more data than last time, and reset the timeout if so
00872                 if (totalBytesSent > lastBytesSent) {
00873                         [self setLastActivityTime:[NSDate date]];
00874                         [self setLastBytesSent:totalBytesSent];
00875                 }
00876 
00877                 // Find out how much data we've uploaded so far
00878                 [self setTotalBytesSent:[[(NSNumber *)CFReadStreamCopyProperty(readStream, kCFStreamPropertyHTTPRequestBytesWrittenCount) autorelease] unsignedLongLongValue]];
00879                         
00880                 
00881                 [self updateProgressIndicators];
00882                 
00883                 // Measure bandwidth used, and throttle if nescessary
00884                 [ASIHTTPRequest measureBandwidthUsage];
00885                 
00886                 // This thread should wait for 1/4 second for the stream to do something. We'll stop early if it does.
00887                 CFRunLoopRunInMode(ASIHTTPRequestRunMode,0.25,YES);
00888 
00889                 
00890                 [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
00891                 
00892                 [pool release];
00893                 
00894         }
00895 
00896 }
00897 
00898 // Cancel loading and clean up. DO NOT USE THIS TO CANCEL REQUESTS - use [request cancel] instead
00899 - (void)cancelLoad
00900 {
00901     if (readStream) {
00902                 CFReadStreamSetClient(readStream, kCFStreamEventNone, NULL, NULL);
00903                 CFReadStreamUnscheduleFromRunLoop(readStream, CFRunLoopGetCurrent(), ASIHTTPRequestRunMode);
00904                 CFReadStreamClose(readStream);
00905                 CFRelease(readStream);
00906                 readStream = NULL;
00907     }
00908         
00909         [[self postBodyReadStream] close];
00910         
00911     if ([self rawResponseData]) {
00912                 [self setRawResponseData:nil];
00913         
00914         // If we were downloading to a file
00915         } else if ([self temporaryFileDownloadPath]) {
00916                 [[self fileDownloadOutputStream] close];
00917                 
00918                 // If we haven't said we might want to resume, let's remove the temporary file too
00919                 if (![self allowResumeForFileDownloads]) {
00920                         [self removeTemporaryDownloadFile];
00921                 }
00922         }
00923         
00924         // Clean up any temporary file used to store request body for streaming
00925         if (![self authenticationChallengeInProgress] && [self didCreateTemporaryPostDataFile]) {
00926                 [self removePostDataFile];
00927                 [self setDidCreateTemporaryPostDataFile:NO];
00928         }
00929         
00930         [self setResponseHeaders:nil];
00931 }
00932 
00933 
00934 - (void)removeTemporaryDownloadFile
00935 {
00936         if ([self temporaryFileDownloadPath]) {
00937                 if ([[NSFileManager defaultManager] fileExistsAtPath:[self temporaryFileDownloadPath]]) {
00938                         NSError *removeError = nil;
00939                         [[NSFileManager defaultManager] removeItemAtPath:[self temporaryFileDownloadPath] error:&removeError];
00940                         if (removeError) {
00941                                 [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIFileManagementError userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:[NSString stringWithFormat:@"Failed to delete file at path '%@'",[self temporaryFileDownloadPath]],NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,removeError,NSUnderlyingErrorKey,nil]]];
00942                         }
00943                 }
00944                 [self setTemporaryFileDownloadPath:nil];
00945         }
00946 }
00947 
00948 - (void)removePostDataFile
00949 {
00950         if ([self postBodyFilePath]) {
00951                 NSError *removeError = nil;
00952                 [[NSFileManager defaultManager] removeItemAtPath:[self postBodyFilePath] error:&removeError];
00953                 if (removeError) {
00954                         [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIFileManagementError userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:[NSString stringWithFormat:@"Failed to delete file at path '%@'",[self postBodyFilePath]],NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,removeError,NSUnderlyingErrorKey,nil]]];
00955                 }
00956                 [self setPostBodyFilePath:nil];
00957         }
00958         if ([self compressedPostBodyFilePath]) {
00959                 NSError *removeError = nil;
00960                 [[NSFileManager defaultManager] removeItemAtPath:[self compressedPostBodyFilePath] error:&removeError];
00961                 if (removeError) {
00962                         [self failWithError:[NSError errorWithDomain:NetworkRequestErrorDomain code:ASIFileManagementError userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:[NSString stringWithFormat:@"Failed to delete file at path '%@'",[self compressedPostBodyFilePath]],NSLocalizedDescriptionKey,removeError,NSUnderlyingErrorKey,nil]]];
00963                 }
00964                 [self setCompressedPostBodyFilePath:nil];
00965         }
00966 }
00967 
00968 #pragma mark HEAD request
00969 
00970 // Used by ASINetworkQueue to create a HEAD request appropriate for this request with the same headers (though you can use it yourself)
00971 - (ASIHTTPRequest *)HEADRequest
00972 {
00973         ASIHTTPRequest *headRequest = [[self class] requestWithURL:[self url]];
00974         [headRequest setMainRequest:self];
00975         [headRequest setRequestMethod:@"HEAD"];
00976         return headRequest;
00977 }
00978 
00979 
00980 #pragma mark upload/download progress
00981 
00982 
00983 - (void)updateProgressIndicators
00984 {
00985         
00986         //Only update progress if this isn't a HEAD request used to preset the content-length
00987         if (!mainRequest) {
00988                 if ([self showAccurateProgress] || ([self complete] && ![self updatedProgress])) {
00989                         [self updateUploadProgress];
00990                         [self updateDownloadProgress];
00991                 }
00992         }
00993         
00994 }
00995 
00996 
00997 - (void)setUploadProgressDelegate:(id)newDelegate
00998 {
00999         [[self cancelledLock] lock];
01000         
01001         uploadProgressDelegate = newDelegate;
01002         
01003         // If the uploadProgressDelegate is an NSProgressIndicator, we set it's MaxValue to 1.0 so we can treat it similarly to UIProgressViews
01004         SEL selector = @selector(setMaxValue:);
01005         if ([uploadProgressDelegate respondsToSelector:selector]) {
01006                 double max = 1.0;
01007                 NSMethodSignature *signature = [[uploadProgressDelegate class] instanceMethodSignatureForSelector:selector];
01008                 NSInvocation *invocation = [NSInvocation invocationWithMethodSignature:signature];
01009                 [invocation setTarget:uploadProgressDelegate];
01010                 [invocation setSelector:selector];
01011                 [invocation setArgument:&max atIndex:2];
01012                 [invocation invoke];
01013                 
01014         }
01015         [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
01016 }
01017 
01018 - (void)setDownloadProgressDelegate:(id)newDelegate
01019 {
01020         [[self cancelledLock] lock];
01021         
01022         downloadProgressDelegate = newDelegate;
01023         
01024         // If the downloadProgressDelegate is an NSProgressIndicator, we set it's MaxValue to 1.0 so we can treat it similarly to UIProgressViews
01025         SEL selector = @selector(setMaxValue:);
01026         if ([downloadProgressDelegate respondsToSelector:selector]) {
01027                 double max = 1.0;
01028                 NSMethodSignature *signature = [[downloadProgressDelegate class] instanceMethodSignatureForSelector:selector];
01029                 NSInvocation *invocation = [NSInvocation invocationWithMethodSignature:signature];
01030                 [invocation setSelector:@selector(setMaxValue:)];
01031                 [invocation setArgument:&max atIndex:2];
01032                 [invocation invokeWithTarget:downloadProgressDelegate];
01033         }       
01034         [[self cancelledLock] unlock];
01035 }
01036 
01037 
01038 - (void)resetUploadProgress:(unsigned long long)value
01039 {
01040         [progressLock lock];
01041         
01042         // Request this request's own upload progress delegate
01043         if (uploadProgressDelegate) {
01044                 [ASIHTTPRequest setProgress:0 forProgressIndicator:uploadProgressDelegate];
01045         }
01046         [progressLock unlock];
01047 }               
01048 
01049 - (void)updateUploadProgress
01050 {
01051         if ([self isCancelled]) {
01052                 return;
01053         }
01054         
01055         // If this is the first time we've written to the buffer, byteCount will be the size of the buffer (currently seems to be 128KB on both Leopard and iPhone 2.2.1, 32KB on iPhone 3.0)
01056         // If request body is less than the buffer size, byteCount will be the total size of the request body
01057         // We will remove this from any progress display, as kCFStreamPropertyHTTPRequestBytesWrittenCount does not tell us how much data has actually be written
01058         if (totalBytesSent > 0 && uploadBufferSize == 0 && totalBytesSent != postLength) {
01059                 [self setUploadBufferSize:totalBytesSent];
01060                 SEL selector = @selector(setUploadBufferSize:);
01061                 if ([queue respondsToSelector:selector]) {
01062                         NSMethodSignature *signature = nil;
01063                         signature = [[queue class] instanceMethodSignatureForSelector:selector];
01064                         NSInvocation *invocation = [NSInvocation invocationWithMethodSignature:signature];
01065                         [invocation setTarget:queue];
01066                         [invocation setSelector:selector];
01067                         [invocation setArgument:&totalBytesSent atIndex:2];
01068                         [invocation invoke];
01069                 }
01070         }
01071         
01072 
01073         
01074 
01075         if (totalBytesSent == 0) {
01076                 return;
01077         }
01078         
01079                 
01080         // Update the progress queue, if we have one
01081         SEL selector = @selector(incrementUploadProgressBy:);
01082         if ([queue respondsToSelector:selector]) {
01083                 unsigned long long value = 0;
01084                 if (showAccurateProgress) {
01085                         if (totalBytesSent == postLength || lastBytesSent > 0) {
01086                                 value = totalBytesSent-lastBytesSent;
01087                         } else {
01088                                 value = 0;
01089                         }
01090                 } else {
01091                         value = 1;
01092                         [self setUpdatedProgress:YES];
01093                 }
01094                 
01095                 NSMethodSignature *signature = nil;
01096                 signature = [[queue class] instanceMethodSignatureForSelector:selector];
01097                 NSInvocation *invocation = [NSInvocation invocationWithMethodSignature:signature];
01098                 [invocation setTarget:queue];
01099                 [invocation setSelector:selector];
01100                 [invocation setArgument:&value atIndex:2];
01101                 [invocation invoke];
01102         }
01103 
01104         // Update this request's own upload progress delegate
01105         if (uploadProgressDelegate) {
01106                 
01107                 double progress;
01108                 //Workaround for an issue with converting a long to a double on iPhone OS 2.2.1 with a base SDK >= 3.0
01109                 if ([ASIHTTPRequest isiPhoneOS2]) {
01110                         progress = [[NSNumber numberWithUnsignedLongLong:(totalBytesSent-uploadBufferSize)/(postLength-uploadBufferSize)] doubleValue]; 
01111                 } else {
01112                         progress = (double)(1.0*(totalBytesSent-uploadBufferSize)/(postLength-uploadBufferSize));
01113                 }
01114                 [self setUpdatedProgress:YES];
01115                 [ASIHTTPRequest setProgress:progress forProgressIndicator:uploadProgressDelegate];
01116                 
01117         }
01118 
01119 }
01120 
01121 
01122 - (void)resetDownloadProgress:(unsigned long long)value
01123 {
01124         [progressLock lock];    
01125         
01126         // Reset download progress for this request in the queue
01127         SEL selector = @selector(incrementDownloadSizeBy:);
01128         if ([queue respondsToSelector:selector]) {
01129                 NSMethodSignature *signature = [[queue class] instanceMethodSignatureForSelector:selector];
01130                 NSInvocation *invocation = [NSInvocation invocationWithMethodSignature:signature];
01131                 [invocation setTarget:queue];
01132                 [invocation setSelector:selector];
01133                 [invocation setArgument:&value atIndex:2];
01134                 [invocation invoke];
01135         }
01136         
01137         // Request this request's own download progress delegate
01138         if (downloadProgressDelegate) {
01139                 [ASIHTTPRequest setProgress:0 forProgressIndicator:downloadProgressDelegate];
01140         }
01141         [progressLock unlock];
01142 }       
01143 
01144 - (void)updateDownloadProgress
01145 {
01146         
01147         
01148         // We won't update download progress until we've examined the headers, since we might need to authenticate
01149         if (responseHeaders) {
01150                 
01151                 unsigned long long bytesReadSoFar = totalBytesRead+partialDownloadSize;
01152 
01153                 // We're using a progress queue or compatible controller to handle progress
01154                 SEL selector = @selector(incrementDownloadProgressBy:);
01155                 if ([queue respondsToSelector:@selector(incrementDownloadProgressBy:)]) {
01156                         
01157                         NSAutoreleasePool *thePool = [[NSAutoreleasePool alloc] init];
01158                         
01159                         unsigned long long value = 0;
01160                         if ([self showAccurateProgress]) {
01161                                 value = bytesReadSoFar-[self lastBytesRead];
01162                         } else {
01163                                 value = 1;
01164                                 [self setUpdatedProgress:YES];
01165                         }
01166                         
01167                         
01168                         NSMethodSignature *signature = [[queue class] instanceMethodSignatureForSelector:selector];
01169                         NSInvocation *invocation = [NSInvocation invocationWithMethodSignature:signature];
01170                         [invocation setTarget:queue];
01171                         [invocation setSelector:selector];
01172                         [invocation setArgument:&value atIndex:2];
01173                         [invocation invoke];
01174                         
01175                         [thePool release];
01176                 }
01177                         
01178                 if (downloadProgressDelegate) {
01179                         if (contentLength > 0)  {
01180                                 double progress;
01181                                 //Workaround for an issue with converting a long to a double on iPhone OS 2.2.1 with a base SDK >= 3.0
01182                                 if ([ASIHTTPRequest isiPhoneOS2]) {
01183                                         progress = [[NSNumber numberWithUnsignedLongLong:bytesReadSoFar/(contentLength+partialDownloadSize)] doubleValue]; 
01184                                 } else {
01185                                         progress = (double)(1.0*bytesReadSoFar/(contentLength+partialDownloadSize));
01186                                 }
01187                                 [self setUpdatedProgress:YES];
01188                                 [ASIHTTPRequest setProgress:progress forProgressIndicator:downloadProgressDelegate];
01189                                 
01190                         // Request has finished, but we've never updated the progress
01191                         // This is either an error, or we got no Content-Length header
01192                         } else if ([self complete] && ![self updatedProgress]) {
01193                                 [self setUpdatedProgress:YES];
01194                                 [ASIHTTPRequest setProgress:1.0 forProgressIndicator:downloadProgressDelegate];
01195                         }
01196                 }
01197                 
01198                 [self setLastBytesRead:bytesReadSoFar];
01199         }
01200         
01201 }
01202 
01203 -(void)removeUploadProgressSoFar
01204 {
01205         
01206         // We're using a progress queue or compatible controller to handle progress
01207         SEL selector = @selector(decrementUploadProgressBy:);
01208         if ([queue respondsToSelector:selector]) {
01209                 unsigned long long value = 0-lastBytesSent;
01210                 
01211                 NSMethodSignature *signature = [[queue class] instanceMethodSignatureForSelector:selector];
01212                 NSInvocation *invocation = [NSInvocation invocationWithMethodSignature:signature];
01213                 [invocation setTarget:queue];
01214                 [invocation setSelector:selector];
01215                 [invocation setArgument:&value atIndex:2];
01216                 [invocation invoke];
01217                 
01218         }
01219         
01220         if (uploadProgressDelegate) {
01221                 [ASIHTTPRequest setProgress:0 forProgressIndicator:uploadProgressDelegate];
01222         }
01223 }
01224 
01225 
01226 + (void)setProgress:(double)progress forProgressIndicator:(id)indicator
01227 {
01228 
01229         SEL selector;
01230         [progressLock lock];
01231         
01232         // Cocoa Touch: UIProgressView
01233         if ([indicator respondsToSelector:@selector(setProgress:)]) {
01234                 selector = @selector(setProgress:);
01235                 NSMethodSignature *signature = [[indicator class] instanceMethodSignatureForSelector:selector];
01236                 NSInvocation *invocation = [NSInvocation invocationWithMethodSignature:signature];
01237                 [invocation setSelector:selector];
01238                 float progressFloat = (float)progress; // UIProgressView wants a float for the progress parameter
01239                 [invocation setArgument:&progressFloat atIndex:2];
01240 
01241                 // If we're running in the main thread, update the progress straight away. Otherwise, it's not that urgent
01242                 [invocation performSelectorOnMainThread:@selector(invokeWithTarget:) withObject:indicator waitUntilDone:[NSThread isMainThread]];
01243 
01244                 
01245         // Cocoa: NSProgressIndicator
01246         } else if ([indicator respondsToSelector:@selector(setDoubleValue:)]) {
01247                 selector = @selector(setDoubleValue:);
01248                 NSMethodSignature *signature = [[indicator class] instanceMethodSignatureForSelector:selector];
01249                 NSInvocation *invocation = [NSInvocation invocationWithMethodSignature:signature];
01250                 [invocation setSelector:selector];
01251                 [invocation setArgument:&progress atIndex:2];
01252                 
01253 
01254                 [invocation performSelectorOnMainThread:@selector(invokeWithTarget:) withObject:indicator waitUntilDone:[NSThread isMainThread]];
01255                 
01256         }
01257         [progressLock unlock];
01258 }
01259 
01260 
01261 #pragma mark handling request complete / failure
01262 
01263 // Subclasses might override this method to process the result in the same thread
01264 // If you do this, don't forget to call [super requestFinished] to let the queue / delegate know we're done
01265 - (void)requestFinished
01266 {
01267         if ([self error] || [self mainRequest]) {
01268                 return;
01269         }
01270         // Let the queue know we are done
01271         if ([[self queue] respondsToSelector:@selector(requestDidFinish:)]) {
01272                 [[self queue] performSelectorOnMainThread:@selector(requestDidFinish:) withObject:self waitUntilDone:[NSThread isMainThread]];          
01273         }
01274         
01275         // Let the delegate know we are done
01276         if ([self didFinishSelector] && [[self delegate] respondsToSelector:[self didFinishSelector]]) {
01277                 [[self delegate] performSelectorOnMainThread:[self didFinishSelector] withObject:self waitUntilDone:[NSThread isMainThread]];           
01278         }
01279 }
01280 
01281 // Subclasses might override this method to perform error handling in the same thread
01282 // If you do this, don't forget to call [super failWithError:] to let the queue / delegate know we're done
01283 - (void)failWithError:(NSError *)theError
01284 {
01285         [self setComplete:YES];
01286         
01287         if ([self isCancelled] || [self error]) {
01288                 return;
01289         }
01290         
01291         // If this is a HEAD request created by an ASINetworkQueue or compatible queue delegate, make the main request fail
01292         if ([self mainRequest]) {
01293                 ASIHTTPRequest *mRequest = [self mainRequest];
01294                 [mRequest setError:theError];
01295 
01296                 // Let the queue know something went wrong
01297                 if ([[self queue] respondsToSelector:@selector(requestDidFail:)]) {
01298                         [[self queue] performSelectorOnMainThread:@selector(requestDidFail:) withObject:mRequest waitUntilDone:[NSThread isMainThread]];                
01299                 }
01300         
01301         } else {
01302                 [self setError:theError];
01303                 
01304                 // Let the queue know something went wrong
01305                 if ([[self queue] respondsToSelector:@selector(requestDidFail:)]) {
01306                         [[self queue] performSelectorOnMainThread:@selector(requestDidFail:) withObject:self waitUntilDone:[NSThread isMainThread]];            
01307                 }
01308                 
01309                 // Let the delegate know something went wrong
01310                 if ([self didFailSelector] && [[self delegate] respondsToSelector:[self didFailSelector]]) {
01311                         [[self delegate] performSelectorOnMainThread:[self didFailSelector] withObject:self waitUntilDone:[NSThread isMainThread]];     
01312                 }
01313         }
01314 }
01315 
01316 #pragma mark parsing HTTP response headers
01317 
01318 - (BOOL)readResponseHeadersReturningAuthenticationFailure
01319 {
01320         [self setAuthenticationChallengeInProgress:NO];
01321         [self setNeedsProxyAuthentication:NO];
01322         BOOL isAuthenticationChallenge = NO;
01323         CFHTTPMessageRef headers = (CFHTTPMessageRef)CFReadStreamCopyProperty(readStream, kCFStreamPropertyHTTPResponseHeader);
01324         if (CFHTTPMessageIsHeaderComplete(headers)) {
01325                 
01326                 CFDictionaryRef headerFields = CFHTTPMessageCopyAllHeaderFields(headers);
01327                 [self setResponseHeaders:(NSDictionary *)headerFields];
01328 
01329                 CFRelease(headerFields);
01330                 [self setResponseStatusCode:CFHTTPMessageGetResponseStatusCode(headers)];
01331                 [self setResponseStatusMessage:[(NSString *)CFHTTPMessageCopyResponseStatusLine(headers) autorelease]];
01332 
01333                 // Is the server response a challenge for credentials?
01334                 isAuthenticationChallenge = ([self responseStatusCode] == 401);
01335                 if ([self responseStatusCode] == 407) {
01336                         isAuthenticationChallenge = YES;
01337                         [self setNeedsProxyAuthentication:YES];
01338                 }
01339                 [self setAuthenticationChallengeInProgress:isAuthenticationChallenge];
01340                 
01341                 // Authentication succeeded, or no authentication was required
01342                 if (!isAuthenticationChallenge) {
01343                         
01344                         // Did we get here without an authentication challenge? (which can happen when shouldPresentCredentialsBeforeChallenge is YES and basic auth was successful)
01345                         if (!requestAuthentication && [self username] && [self password] && [self useSessionPersistance]) {
01346                                 
01347                                 NSMutableDictionary *newCredentials = [NSMutableDictionary dictionaryWithCapacity:2];
01348                                 [newCredentials setObject:[self username] forKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationUsername];
01349                                 [newCredentials setObject:[self password] forKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationPassword];
01350                                 
01351                                 // Store the credentials in the session 
01352                                 NSMutableDictionary *sessionCredentials = [NSMutableDictionary dictionary];
01353                                 [sessionCredentials setObject:newCredentials forKey:@"Credentials"];
01354                                 [sessionCredentials setObject:[self url] forKey:@"URL"];
01355                                 [sessionCredentials setObject:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationSchemeBasic forKey:@"AuthenticationScheme"];
01356                                 [[self class] storeAuthenticationCredentialsInSessionStore:sessionCredentials];
01357                         }
01358                         
01359                         
01360                         // See if we got a Content-length header
01361                         NSString *cLength = [responseHeaders valueForKey:@"Content-Length"];
01362                         if (cLength) {
01363                                 [self setContentLength:CFStringGetIntValue((CFStringRef)cLength)];
01364                                 if ([self mainRequest]) {
01365                                         [[self mainRequest] setContentLength:contentLength];
01366                                 }
01367                                 if ([self showAccurateProgress] && [self shouldResetProgressIndicators]) {
01368                                         [self resetDownloadProgress:[self contentLength]+[self partialDownloadSize]];
01369                                 }
01370                         }
01371                         
01372                         // Handle response text encoding
01373                         // If the Content-Type header specified an encoding, we'll use that, otherwise we use defaultStringEncoding (which defaults to NSISOLatin1StringEncoding)
01374                         NSString *contentType = [[self responseHeaders] objectForKey:@"Content-Type"];
01375                         NSStringEncoding encoding = [self defaultResponseEncoding];
01376                         if (contentType) {
01377 
01378                                 NSString *charsetSeparator = @"charset=";
01379                                 NSScanner *charsetScanner = [NSScanner scannerWithString: contentType];
01380                                 NSString *IANAEncoding = nil;
01381 
01382                                 if ([charsetScanner scanUpToString: charsetSeparator intoString: NULL] && [charsetScanner scanLocation] < [contentType length])
01383                                 {
01384                                         [charsetScanner setScanLocation: [charsetScanner scanLocation] + [charsetSeparator length]];
01385                                         [charsetScanner scanUpToString: @";" intoString: &IANAEncoding];
01386                                 }
01387 
01388                                 if (IANAEncoding) {
01389                                         CFStringEncoding cfEncoding = CFStringConvertIANACharSetNameToEncoding((CFStringRef)IANAEncoding);
01390                                         if (cfEncoding != kCFStringEncodingInvalidId) {
01391                                                 encoding = CFStringConvertEncodingToNSStringEncoding(cfEncoding);
01392                                         }
01393                                 }
01394                         }
01395                         [self setResponseEncoding:encoding];
01396                         
01397                         // Handle cookies
01398                         NSArray *newCookies = [NSHTTPCookie cookiesWithResponseHeaderFields:responseHeaders forURL:url];
01399                         [self setResponseCookies:newCookies];
01400                         
01401                         if ([self useCookiePersistance]) {
01402                                 
01403                                 // Store cookies in global persistent store
01404                                 [[NSHTTPCookieStorage sharedHTTPCookieStorage] setCookies:newCookies forURL:url mainDocumentURL:nil];
01405                                 
01406                                 // We also keep any cookies in the sessionCookies array, so that we have a reference to them if we need to remove them later
01407                                 NSHTTPCookie *cookie;
01408                                 for (cookie in newCookies) {
01409                                         [ASIHTTPRequest addSessionCookie:cookie];
01410                                 }
01411                         }
01412                         // Do we need to redirect?
01413                         if ([self shouldRedirect] && [responseHeaders valueForKey:@"Location"]) {
01414                                 if ([self responseStatusCode] > 300 && [self responseStatusCode] < 308 && [self responseStatusCode] != 304) {
01415                                         if ([self responseStatusCode] == 303) {
01416                                                 [self setRequestMethod:@"GET"];
01417                                                 [self setPostBody:nil];
01418                                                 [self setPostLength:0];
01419                                                 [self setRequestHeaders:nil];
01420                                         }
01421                                         // Force the redirected request to rebuild the request headers (if not a 303, it will re-use old ones, and add any new ones)
01422                                         [self setHaveBuiltRequestHeaders:NO];
01423                                         [self setURL:[[NSURL URLWithString:[responseHeaders valueForKey:@"Location"] relativeToURL:[self url]] absoluteURL]];
01424                                         [self setNeedsRedirect:YES];
01425                                         
01426                                         // Clear the request cookies
01427                                         // This means manually added cookies will not be added to the redirect request - only those stored in the global persistent store
01428                                         // But, this is probably the safest option - we might be redirecting to a different domain
01429                                         [self setRequestCookies:[NSMutableArray array]];
01430                                 }
01431                         }
01432                         
01433                 }
01434                 
01435         }
01436         CFRelease(headers);
01437         return isAuthenticationChallenge;
01438 }
01439         
01440 
01441 #pragma mark http authentication
01442 
01443 - (void)saveProxyCredentialsToKeychain:(NSDictionary *)newCredentials
01444 {
01445         NSURLCredential *authenticationCredentials = [NSURLCredential credentialWithUser:[newCredentials objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationUsername] password:[newCredentials objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationPassword] persistence:NSURLCredentialPersistencePermanent];
01446         if (authenticationCredentials) {
01447                 [ASIHTTPRequest saveCredentials:authenticationCredentials forProxy:[self proxyHost] port:[self proxyPort] realm:[self proxyAuthenticationRealm]];
01448         }       
01449 }
01450 
01451 
01452 - (void)saveCredentialsToKeychain:(NSDictionary *)newCredentials
01453 {
01454         NSURLCredential *authenticationCredentials = [NSURLCredential credentialWithUser:[newCredentials objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationUsername] password:[newCredentials objectForKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationPassword] persistence:NSURLCredentialPersistencePermanent];
01455         
01456         if (authenticationCredentials) {
01457                 [ASIHTTPRequest saveCredentials:authenticationCredentials forHost:[[self url] host] port:[[[self url] port] intValue] protocol:[[self url] scheme] realm:[self authenticationRealm]];
01458         }       
01459 }
01460 
01461 - (BOOL)applyProxyCredentials:(NSDictionary *)newCredentials
01462 {
01463         [self setProxyAuthenticationRetryCount:[self proxyAuthenticationRetryCount]+1];
01464         
01465         if (newCredentials && proxyAuthentication && request) {
01466 
01467                 // Apply whatever credentials we've built up to the old request
01468                 if (CFHTTPMessageApplyCredentialDictionary(request, proxyAuthentication, (CFMutableDictionaryRef)newCredentials, NULL)) {
01469                         
01470                         //If we have credentials and they're ok, let's save them to the keychain
01471                         if (useKeychainPersistance) {
01472                                 [self saveProxyCredentialsToKeychain:newCredentials];
01473                         }
01474                         if (useSessionPersistance) {
01475                                 NSMutableDictionary *sessionProxyCredentials = [NSMutableDictionary dictionary];
01476                                 [sessionProxyCredentials setObject:(id)proxyAuthentication forKey:@"Authentication"];
01477                                 [sessionProxyCredentials setObject:newCredentials forKey:@"Credentials"];
01478                                 [sessionProxyCredentials setObject:[self proxyHost] forKey:@"Host"];
01479                                 [sessionProxyCredentials setObject:[NSNumber numberWithInt:[self proxyPort]] forKey:@"Port"];
01480                                 [sessionProxyCredentials setObject:[self proxyAuthenticationScheme] forKey:@"AuthenticationScheme"];
01481                                 [[self class] storeProxyAuthenticationCredentialsInSessionStore:sessionProxyCredentials];
01482                         }
01483                         [self setProxyCredentials:newCredentials];
01484                         return YES;
01485                 } else {
01486                         [[self class] removeProxyAuthenticationCredentialsFromSessionStore:newCredentials];
01487                 }
01488         }
01489         return NO;
01490 }
01491 
01492 - (BOOL)applyCredentials:(NSDictionary *)newCredentials
01493 {
01494         [self setAuthenticationRetryCount:[self authenticationRetryCount]+1];
01495         
01496         if (newCredentials && requestAuthentication && request) {
01497                 // Apply whatever credentials we've built up to the old request
01498                 if (CFHTTPMessageApplyCredentialDictionary(request, requestAuthentication, (CFMutableDictionaryRef)newCredentials, NULL)) {
01499                         
01500                         //If we have credentials and they're ok, let's save them to the keychain
01501                         if (useKeychainPersistance) {
01502                                 [self saveCredentialsToKeychain:newCredentials];
01503                         }
01504                         if (useSessionPersistance) {
01505                                 
01506                                 NSMutableDictionary *sessionCredentials = [NSMutableDictionary dictionary];
01507                                 [sessionCredentials setObject:(id)requestAuthentication forKey:@"Authentication"];
01508                                 [sessionCredentials setObject:newCredentials forKey:@"Credentials"];
01509                                 [sessionCredentials setObject:[self url] forKey:@"URL"];
01510                                 [sessionCredentials setObject:[self authenticationScheme] forKey:@"AuthenticationScheme"];
01511                                 if ([self authenticationRealm]) {
01512                                         [sessionCredentials setObject:[self authenticationRealm] forKey:@"AuthenticationRealm"];
01513                                 }
01514                                 [[self class] storeAuthenticationCredentialsInSessionStore:sessionCredentials];
01515 
01516                         }
01517                         [self setRequestCredentials:newCredentials];
01518                         return YES;
01519                 } else {
01520                         [[self class] removeAuthenticationCredentialsFromSessionStore:newCredentials];
01521                 }
01522         }
01523         return NO;
01524 }
01525 
01526 - (NSMutableDictionary *)findProxyCredentials
01527 {
01528         NSMutableDictionary *newCredentials = [[[NSMutableDictionary alloc] init] autorelease];
01529         
01530         // Is an account domain needed? (used currently for NTLM only)
01531         if (CFHTTPAuthenticationRequiresAccountDomain(proxyAuthentication)) {
01532                 if (![self proxyDomain]) {
01533                         [self setProxyDomain:@""];
01534                 }
01535                 [newCredentials setObject:[self proxyDomain] forKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationAccountDomain];
01536         }
01537         
01538         NSString *user = nil;
01539         NSString *pass = nil;
01540         
01541 
01542         // If this is a HEAD request generated by an ASINetworkQueue, we'll try to use the details from the main request
01543         if ([self mainRequest] && [[self mainRequest] proxyUsername] && [[self mainRequest] proxyPassword]) {
01544                 user = [[self mainRequest] proxyUsername];
01545                 pass = [[self mainRequest] proxyPassword];
01546                 
01547                 // Let's try to use the ones set in this object
01548         } else if ([self proxyUsername] && [self proxyPassword]) {
01549                 user = [self proxyUsername];
01550                 pass = [self proxyPassword];
01551         }               
01552 
01553         
01554         // Ok, that didn't work, let's try the keychain
01555         // For authenticating proxies, we'll look in the keychain regardless of the value of useKeychainPersistance
01556         if ((!user || !pass)) {
01557                 NSURLCredential *authenticationCredentials = [ASIHTTPRequest savedCredentialsForProxy:[self proxyHost] port:[self proxyPort] protocol:[[self url] scheme] realm:[self proxyAuthenticationRealm]];
01558                 if (authenticationCredentials) {
01559                         user = [authenticationCredentials user];
01560                         pass = [authenticationCredentials password];
01561                 }
01562                 
01563         }
01564         
01565         // If we have a username and password, let's apply them to the request and continue
01566         if (user && pass) {
01567                 
01568                 [newCredentials setObject:user forKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationUsername];
01569                 [newCredentials setObject:pass forKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationPassword];
01570                 return newCredentials;
01571         }
01572         return nil;
01573 }
01574 
01575 
01576 - (NSMutableDictionary *)findCredentials
01577 {
01578         NSMutableDictionary *newCredentials = [[[NSMutableDictionary alloc] init] autorelease];
01579         
01580         // Is an account domain needed? (used currently for NTLM only)
01581         if (CFHTTPAuthenticationRequiresAccountDomain(requestAuthentication)) {
01582                 if (!domain) {
01583                         [self setDomain:@""];
01584                 }
01585                 [newCredentials setObject:domain forKey:(NSString *)kCFHTTPAuthenticationAccountDomain];
01586         }
01587         
01588         // First, let's look at the url to see if the username and password were included
01589         NSString *user = [[self url] user];
01590         NSString *pass = [[self url] password];
01591         
01592         // If the username and password weren't in the url
01593         if (!user || !pass) {
01594                 
01595                 // If this is a HEAD request generated by an ASINetworkQueue, we'll try to use the details from the main request
01596                 if ([self mainRequest] && [[self mainRequest] username] && [[self mainRequest] password]) {
01597                         user = [[self mainRequest] username];
01598                         pass = [[self mainRequest] password];
01599                         
01600                 // Let's try to use the ones set in this object
01601                 } else if ([self username] && [self password]) {
